page.title: 03BURHAM - CHURCHES JOIN
page.content: This development made a vast difference to the people of the village who had been used to their own buildings over the last hundred years and prior to that the Church of England still had their own building down by the River Medway where the original site of the village stands. It was then decided to modernise the present Methodist Church building making it bigger and the cost to be shared between the two Churches. In May 1985 after the alterations were completed the Church reopened under a new name, {THE CHURCH IN BURHAM.} This arrangement seems to be working very well so far with both denominations showing care and concern for each others beliefs.
